description:
I have a Devstack setup with Quantum and I was following through the quantum doc.
Issuing the cmd:   $ nova-manage network create          I get:

Command failed, please check log for more info
2012-02-24 12:02:52 CRITICAL nova [-] Please specify either fixed_range or uuid
 (nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/local/bin/nova-manage", line 7, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     execfile(__file__)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/bin/nova-manage", line 2376, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     main()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/bin/nova-manage", line 2363, in main
(nova): TRACE:     fn(*fn_args, **fn_kwargs)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/bin/nova-manage", line 901, in delete
(nova): TRACE:     raise Exception("Please specify either fixed_range or uuid")
(nova): TRACE: Exception: Please specify either fixed_range or uuid
(nova): TRACE: 

I get similar traces on other cmds associated with  "nova-manage network"

On using a proper cmd like  $ nova-manage network create --label=public --fixed_range_v4=8.8.8.0/24
I get a lot of debugging information on the terminal but the cmd is successful.

Please let me know if you need more details about the setup.
title: Improper error messages with traces associated with  'nova-manage'   cmds

comments.content:
The traceback seems to be coming from this part of nova-manage script:

    except TypeError:
        print _("Possible wrong number of arguments supplied")
        print fn.__doc__
        parser.print_help()
        raise
    except Exception:
        print _("Command failed, please check log for more info")
        raise

After catching the exceptons, Instead of simply raising it, we should be printing the appropriate msg contained and log it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~deepak.garg

comments.content:
To be clear, this is not just associated with just  'nova-manage network create'  command. This is true for every nova-manage command in which some required fields are not passed.  To confirm, I did a fresh new install of devstack (without quantum services)  in a new VM  and tried the   '$ nova-manage user create '  cmd. Here's is the output:

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
deepak@deepak-devvm:~/devstack$ nova-manage user create
Possible wrong number of arguments supplied
creates a new user and prints exports
Usage: nova-manage user create <args> [options]

Options:
  -h, --help         show this help message and exit
  --name=<name>      User name
  --access=<access>  Access
  --secret=<secret>  Secret
2012-02-25 08:56:23 CRITICAL nova [-] create() takes at least 2 arguments (1 given)
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/local/bin/nova-manage", line 7, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     execfile(__file__)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/bin/nova-manage", line 2459, in <module>
(nova): TRACE:     main()
(nova): TRACE:   File "/opt/stack/nova/bin/nova-manage", line 2446, in main
(nova): TRACE:     fn(*fn_args, **fn_kwargs)
(nova): TRACE: TypeError: create() takes at least 2 arguments (1 given)
(nova): TRACE: 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
And the reason is the same piece of code snippet above.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~deepak.garg

comments.content:
Chat with Anthony on Sunday 11 Mar. 2012

Deepak Garg 11:16:52 IST
hi Anthony, https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/940083  is a small issue, but I have a fix ready for this but I need someone to confirm the bug. You can reproduce this just by typing  "$ nova-manage user create "  and you should see the traceback	

Anthony Young 11:45:14 IST
hey deepak - yes, I can reproduce this
The issue is that the output is unhelpful, from the looks of it
11:46:04 IST
 
Deepak Garg 11:47:06 IST
k, but issuing a traceback on the terminal screen does not seem a good idea to me. I think the exception raised should be logged.	

Anthony Young 11:48:04 IST
agreed.  but it would also be nice to know exactly which arguments are required.  Just missing params isn't really an error, imo.
so for user create, it should have printed the help text, which should have distinguished needed from optional args.
11:49:57 IST
and of course, no exception 
11:50:10 IST
 
Deepak Garg 11:50:10 IST
k, when we do a  $ nova-manage user    , we get a list of sub-cmds that could be used.  now when we do a nova-manage user create  there are no more sub-cmds,  
not sure, but I  guess there is no help text for  subcmds  e.g. $ nova-manage help user create
11:51:10 IST
 
Anthony Young 11:53:28 IST
I get this: http://pastie.org/3568892 - so there is some help text, but it is only marginally useful
so it should say --name is required, and the other params are not
11:53:50 IST
 
Deepak Garg 11:56:47 IST
The issue of the keyword params being optional or not might need to be taken care of a lot of other sub-cmds. So, it may be addressed in a separate ticket.  IMO we should fix the traceback for now.  For a normal user/admin  it gives the impression as if the system has broken or something.	

Anthony Young 11:57:34 IST
fair enough
